item.title: 2-way communication between Fibers
item.description: Introduction If you're writing concurrent code in Crystal, chances are you're relying on Channels to pass information between Fibers. This works very well when dealing with one-way communication - i.e. when the information flows in one direction only - but probably leaves you wondering how to pass information back and forth between fibers. In this article, we show a simple pattern to achieve two-way communication between fibers, and then iterate over it, to make it more user-friendly.
